intro: Guettarda baracoensis, commonly known as the Caribbean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Guettarda baracoensis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
